Events that occurred on 24 July

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1915 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes the poem The Happy Mariners.
1916 - J.R.R. Tolkien's second five-day front-line duty begins.
1938 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 31.
1968 - Artist Colleen Doran is born.
1971 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 326.
1982 - The second episode of the new version of the 1981 radio series of The Lord of the Rings is aired on BBC Radio 4.
1987 - Mythcon 18 at Marquette University, Milwaukee.
2008 - The Lord of the Rings Online: Shadows of Angmar, "The Ring-forges of Eregion" is released in Europe.
2009 - Tolkien Thing 2009 in Rieneck, Germany.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
T.A. 3019:
The funeral procession of king Th√©oden travels toward Edoras
